revised_title: Liminal Brightness Increment: A Study of Foveal and Parafoveal Retina
tldr: This study investigates the liminal brightness increment, or the smallest difference in brightness that can be detected, in foveal and parafoveal vision. The research explores how this threshold varies with different wavelengths of light and under various conditions of adaptation. The findings reveal unique characteristics in the brightness increment at specific wavelengths, which may be connected to the three mechanisms postulated by the trichromacy theory.
